topic.title: HPE Helion 2.0 Development Platform: Upgrading HPE Helion OpenStack to Version 2.1

body.p: When upgrading HPE Helion OpenStack from version 2.0 to 2.1, shutting down the virtual machines which run the control plane will also affect the services that make up the HPE Helion Development Platform. Perform these additional steps to safely shut down these specific services prior to upgrading and then to restart them after the upgrade is complete. This is not an upgrade for the HPE Helion Development Platform. It does not add any new functionality or change existing functionality. The process documented here ensures that the HPE Helion Development Platform is shut down and restarted safely when performing the latest upgrade to HPE Helion OpenStack. If your HPE Helion OpenStack installation does not include the HPE Helion Development Platform, this process does not apply to you.

section.title: Application Lifecycle Service
section.p: No additional steps are required prior to upgrading HPE Helion OpenStack.

section.title: Database Service
section.p:
The database instances and clusters must be gracefully stopped manually prior to upgrading HPE Helion OpenStack.
Download the upgrade scripts (14.9 kb).The easiest option is to download directly to the physical machine hosting the HPE Helion OpenStack lifecycle manager. If you can not download directly to that location, download the files to portable storage media and then copy the files onto the lifecycle manager. When downloading or copying, make sure there is enough space; the file sizes can be significant.
SSH to the HPE Helion OpenStack lifecycle manager (previously known as the deployer node).
Decompress the downloaded file (DevelopmentPlatformUpgrade-2.1.tar.gz) to a local temp directory.tar -xzf DevelopmentPlatformUpgrade-2.1.tar.gz
Source a virtual environment containing the OpenStack clients. Best practice is to use the built-in virtual environment on the HPE Helion OpenStack lifecycle manager, as follows:
List all available virtual environments. ls /opt/stack/venv
One of the names in that list will look like: openstackclient-<timestamp>. Copy the entire virtual environment name, including the timestamp value, for use in the next step.
Source the virtual environment.source /opt/stack/venv/<VirtualEnvironmentName>/bin/activate
Execute the following command to source credentials with access to the service. source service.osrc
Disable access to the Trove API. This will stop all activity.ansible-playbook --private-key <path to SSH private key> -i ./common_upgrade/inventory/inventory.py ./control_plane_upgrade/playbooks/stop-api.yml The SSH private key file is the one that was specified during installation of the database service. This same key will be used for all commands in this guide.
Safely stop all guest databases and clusters.ansible-playbook --extra-vars guest_private_key_file=<path to SSH private key> --private-key <path to SSH private key> -i ./common_upgrade/inventory/inventory.py ./guest-upgrade/playbooks/stop-guests.yml Once the guest database instances and clusters are stopped, they will become inaccessible to applications that use them until they are restarted. Plan this outage window ahead of time and notify your users in advance.
Safely stop the Trove services .ansible-playbook --private-key <path to SSH private key> -i ./common_upgrade/inventory/inventory.py ./control_plane_upgrade/playbooks/control_plane_stop.yml
Safely stop all control plane instances. ./control_plane_upgrade/scripts/stop_control_plane_instances.bash

topic.title: Upgrade HPE Helion OpenStack to version 2.1

body.p: For complete instructions on how to upgrade HPE Helion OpenStack, see the Upgrade Documentation.

section.title: Application Lifecycle Service
section.p: If any ALS clusters do not restart after the HPE Helion OpenStack upgrade is completed, perform the following steps.

ol.li: Start core node.
Start secondary controller nodes.
Start secondary routers.
Start service broker nodes.
Start DEAs.

section.title: Database Service
section.p: The database instances and clusters must be restarted safely after upgrading HPE Helion OpenStack.
section.note: It is recommended to delete nova instances that are named hot_pools; do not delete instances that include any additional naming to hot_pools

ol.li: Restart all control plane instances../control_plane_upgrade/scripts/start_control_plane_instances.bash

Safely start the Trove services.ansible-playbook --private-key <path to SSH private key> -i ./common_upgrade/inventory/inventory.py ./control_plane_upgrade/playbooks/control_plane_start.ymlIf any of the services do not restart [FAILED = 1], add floating IPs to all the instances in the Database control plane and run this playbook again. These instances are created during installation and can be accessed through the Horizon dashboard or Nova client.

Start all database instances and clusters. This script may take some time to fully execute.ansible-playbook --extra-vars guest_private_key_file=<path to SSH private key> --private-key <path to SSH private key> -i ./common_upgrade/inventory/inventory.py ./guest-upgrade/playbooks/start-guests.yml
Verify that all guest instances were restarted successfully. cat ~/guest-instance-status.log

Restart the Database API service. After this step the database service will be fully functional.ansible-playbook --private-key <path to SSH private key> -i ./common_upgrade/inventory/inventory.py ./control_plane_upgrade/playbooks/start-api.yml

section.title: HPE Helion Code Engine
section.p: All nodes are rebooted during the upgrade. The platform services need to be restarted in a specific order.

ol.li:
If unknown, determine the IP address of the helionce_deployer instance.
From the HPE Helion OpenStack lifecycle manager, list all available machines. source helionce.osrc openstack server list
Find the instance named helionce_deployer in the list and make a note of its IP address.
SSH into the helionce_deployer instance.ssh -i helionce-shared stack@<IP address of the helionce_deployer instance>
Navigate to the /home/stack/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible folder.

Run the following playbooks:ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts FND-CLU-start.ymlansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts percona-bootstrap.ymlansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts rabbitmq-start.ymlansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts helionci-restart.yml

section.title: Messaging Service
section.p: After the HPE Helion OpenStack upgrade is completed, perform these steps to bring up the messaging control plane.

ol.li: SSH into the HPE Helion OpenStack lifecycle manager. ssh stack@<hos-deployer-ip>
From the HPE Helion OpenStack lifecycle manager, SSH into the Messaging deployer node. This was created during installation of the Messaging service.ssh stack@<messaging-deployer-ip>
Navigate to the ansible scratch directory. cd scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible/

Run the following playbooks in this order. ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts FND-CLU-start.ymlansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts percona-bootstrap.ymlansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts cue-stop.ymlansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts cue-start.yml
Disconnect from the Messaging deployer node and HPE Helion OpenStack lifecycle manager node.

section.p: After the HPE Helion OpenStack upgrade is completed, perform these steps to bring up the tenant RabbitMQ Clusters.
section.note: If you did not previously deploy any RabbitMQ clusters, the following steps do not apply to your environment.

ol.li: SSH into the HPE Helion OpenStack lifecycle manager. ssh stack@<hos-deployer-ip>
From the HPE Helion OpenStack lifecycle manager, SSH into the Messaging deployer node. This was created during installation of the Messaging service.ssh stack@<messaging-deployer-ip>
Navigate to the ansible scratch directory. cd scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible/

Run the RabbitMQ cluster recovery script.
Copy this codeblock into a plaintext file and save it as cue-rabbit-fix.sh
Copy the script file into this directory on the messaging deployer. /home/stack/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible
Make the script executable. chmod +x cue-rabbit-fix.sh
Execute the script to bring all your RabbitMQ clusters online../cue-rabbit-fix.sh

Verify Installation
Set endpoint type to internal. (The public endpoint cannot be reached from the messaging deployer.)export OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE=internalURL export OS_INTERFACE=internal
List all clusters. Since you have not yet created any clusters, this list of clusters will be empty, but it should execute without returning any error messages. stack@messaging-deployer:~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible$ /opt/stack/service/cueclient/venv/bin/openstack message-broker cluster list
If you have configured TLS, make sure that the Cue public endpoint begins with https and not just http:openstack catalog list
Disconnect from the Messaging deployer node and HPE Helion OpenStack lifecycle manager node.
